choices.C: Anything stored or returned that contains confidential material
choices.A: HTTP session token that provides authorization to Vault
choices.D: Engine responsible for logging all requests and responses
choices.B: Threshold of keys required to unseal the Vault

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

questions.question_text: What is a secret in the context of Vault?

What methods of authentication does Vault support? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
ABCG

The other methods are not allowed

Selected Answer: ABCG
MMSQL, Nomad and PostgreSQL aren't supported Auth Methods.

Selected Answer: B
B False
https://developer.hashicorp.com/vault/docs/agent-and-proxy/agent/caching#renewal-management

" Note that shutting down the agent does not indicate revocations of the secrets, instead it only means that renewal responsibility for all the valid unrevoked secrets are no longer performed by the Vault agent."

B

Asked IA tool:

In HashiCorp Vault, the Vault Agent is a tool that helps automate the obtaining and renewal of Vault access tokens. If the Vault Agent is stopped abruptly, tokens and leases that were granted by Vault will remain valid until they expire according to the configured time to live (TTL).

questions.question_text: Vault Agent allows client-side caching of tokens and leases. If the agent is shut down, those tokens and leases cached will be revoked.

discussion.content:
A

Periodic token (only token which can be renew indefinitely)

Orphan token: Orphan tokens still expire when their own max TTL is reached.
Use-limite token: Only indicates the number of times it can be used, but expires when it is due.
Root Token: they are the only type of token within Vault that can be set to never expire without any renewal needed
E: no sense

Selected Answer: A
Described here " At issue time, the TTL of a periodic token will be equal to the configured period. At every renewal time, the TTL will be reset back to this configured period, and as long as the token is successfully renewed within each of these periods of time, it will never expire. Outside of root tokens, it is currently the only way for a token in Vault to have an unlimited lifetime."

questions.question_text: Which kind of token can be renewed indefinitely?
